feed.title: NewsTracker: holmes
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: The Latest: Holmes says he hoped to be stopped before attack
entry.summary:
James Holmes says he wondered if he was under FBI surveillance as he prepared to attack moviegoers and that he hoped agents would stop him.

Prosecutors are methodically building a case that Holmes knew right from wrong when he planned and carried out the deadly Colorado theater shooting, hoping to convince jurors that he should be convicted and executed and not sent to a mental hospital.

entry.title: Holmes: Mind 'Was Kind of Falling Apart' Before Shooting
entry.summary:
Holmes told a state-appointed psychiatrist in the videotaped interview that he had contracted mononucleosis in late 2011 and became depressed and lacked energy partly because of a breakup with a girlfriend in early 2012.

Asked by Reid whether he ever thought about hurting or killing himself, Holmes replied: "No."

entry.title: Holmes: Mind 'was kind of falling apart' before shooting
entry.summary: Asked about killing other people, Holmes said: "Yes."

entry.title: Holmes: Mind 'was kind of falling apart' before shooting
entry.summary: Holmes said faith was important to his mother but that he was "never really a believer."

entry.title: Holmes: Mind 'was kind of falling apart' before shooting
The Latest: James Holmes says God would care about shootings
entry.summary: Jurors heard Holmes' remarks in a video of his interview with Dr. William Reid.

entry.title: The Latest: James Holmes says God would care about shootings
entry.summary:
James Holmes described God as "everything" in an interview with a state-appointed psychiatrist that was shown at Holmes' death penalty trial on Friday.

Holmes said that as "everything," God would care about the shootings only because they changed something.

Jurors in the Colorado theater shooting trial are again watching James Holmes' videotaped interview with a state-appointed psychiatrist, after a roughly 20-minute interruption caused by a technical glitch.

entry.title: The Latest: James Holmes says God would care about shootings
entry.summary: A technical glitch has interrupted attempts to show jurors in the Colorado theater shooting trial another segment of a video of defendant James Holmes being interviewed by a state-appointed psychiatrist.

entry.title: Psychiatrist: Colorado shooter knew what he was doing
entry.summary:
Reid, called as a prosecution witness, said Thursday that despite his mental illness, Holmes didn't meet the requirements to be found insane under Colorado law.

Defense attorneys are expected to call other psychiatrists who will testify that Holmes was insane.

Reid, who interviewed a medicated Holmes two years after the shooting, declared that whatever mental illness Holmes had, "it did not prevent him from forming intent and knowing the consequences of what he was doing."

Did Holmes have a serious mental illness?

Despite that illness, did Holmes have "the capacity to know right from wrong" on July 19 and 20, 2012, the night of the attack?

entry.title: Psychiatrist: Colorado shooter knew what he was doing
entry.summary:
Dr. William Reid was the first expert witness to testify about Holmes' mental state at the time of the July 20, 2012, massacre, which also left 70 people injured.

He said Holmes suffered a "physical and mental breakdown" in November 2012, five months after his arrest, when he was treated at a Denver hospital and began taking anti-psychotic and other medications.

entry.title: Colorado theater shooter asked police if children were hurt
entry.summary:
(AP) - A video played for jurors in the trial of Colorado theater shooter James Holmes includes a dazed-sounding Holmes asking detectives "There weren't any children hurt, were there?"

The video shows detectives interviewing Holmes at the Aurora Police Department about two hours after the July 2012 attack, which killed 12 people and injured 70 others.

entry.title: The Latest: Video shows Holmes saying he regrets attack
entry.summary:
A video recorded about two years after the Colorado theater shooting shows James Holmes telling a state-appointed psychiatrist he regrets the deadly attack and sometimes cries about it.

William Reid testified Thursday that Holmes was able to form intent and knew the consequences of what he was doing at the time of the July 2012 attack.

entry.title: The Latest: Video shows Holmes saying he regrets attack
entry.summary:
A state-appointed psychiatrist says he did about 300 hours of research before starting to interview James Holmes in late July 2014, over two years after Holmes opened fire at a Colorado movie theater.

The Colorado theater shooting trial is in recess for lunch, and the judge says he'll use the break to think about an undisclosed issue that came up as soon as a state-appointed psychiatrist gave his opinion about James Holmes' sanity.

entry.title: Jurors hear from Holmes on video that he regretted attack
entry.summary: In the video, Reid asks Holmes if he got emotional when his parents visited him in jail for the first time.

entry.title: Jurors hear from Holmes on video that he regretted attack
entry.summary: "Just regrets," Holmes responds.

entry.title: The Latest: Psychiatrist who examined James Holmes testifies
entry.summary: Prosecutors in the Colorado theater shooting are steadily moving toward the heart of their case: the testimony of two court-appointed doctors expected to say James Holmes was sane when he opened fire on a packed midnight showing of a Batman movie.

entry.title: The Latest: Psychiatrist who examined James Holmes testifies
entry.summary:
The second of two state-appointed psychiatrists who examined the Colorado theater gunman is testifying at James Holmes' trial in suburban Denver.

Excerpts of William Reid's 22 hours of videotaped interviews with Holmes were played on the trial's opening day.

But before Reid took the stand Thursday, Judge Carlos Samour said Reid won't be able to say whether Holmes had a particular mental state at the time of the July 2012 mass shooting.

entry.title: The Latest: Courthouse empties after Day 1 of Holmes trial
entry.summary: A defense attorney has showed jurors a video of James Holmes shortly after his arrest in a deadly 2012 rampage at a Colorado movie theater.

entry.title: The Latest: Holmes called wounded 'collateral damage'
entry.summary: Some victims' family members and survivors of the Colorado theater shooting have arrived at court in advance of opening statements in James Holmes' trial.

entry.title: Theater shooting prosecutors build case that Holmes was sane
entry.summary: Pitt said the notebook provides strong evidence that Holmes was mentally ill, which the defense could use to argue against the death penalty if he is convicted.

entry.title: Theater shooting prosecutors build case that Holmes was sane
entry.summary:
After a month of testimony from victims and investigators, prosecutors this week shifted to Holmes' mental state.

They showed jurors Holmes' notes on how long it would take police to respond to an attack on the suburban Denver movie theater, as well as his dating website profile that asked, "Will you visit me in prison?"

A state-appointed psychiatrist who examined Holmes, William Reid, is expected to testify Thursday.

District Attorney George Brauchler has already told jurors that the doctor concluded Holmes was legally sane.

Defense attorney Daniel King told jurors that much of the notebook consists of Holmes' confused musings about his life.

entry.title: Theater gunman's writings alternate between ramblings, plans
entry.summary:
Colorado theater shooting gunman James Holmes' notebook full of scrawled writings and stick-figure drawings was made public Wednesday, a day after it was introduced as evidence in his trial.

The writings on about 30 pages in the brown, spiral school notebook alternate between sometimes incoherent ramblings and Holmes' methodical plans to attack the movie theater and maximize the number of people killed.

It's unclear when Holmes wrote the entries.

Holmes writes.

entry.title: James Holmes, Colorado theater shooter, asked police if children were hurt
entry.summary: Prosecutors say Holmes knew what he was doing.

entry.title: James Holmes, Colorado theater shooter, asked police if children were hurt
entry.summary: Chuck Mehl testified later that Holmes had seen a sign in the police department that said 'Crimes Against Children Unit,' which might have prompted the question.

entry.title: Insane or evil? Trial fills in details of Colorado movie gunman Holmes
entry.summary:
Both sides painted starkly different pictures of Holmes in Arapahoe County District Court in the Denver suburb of Centennial.

In his opening statement, Arapahoe County District Attorney George Brauchler depicted Holmes as a craven killer of superior intellect who planned and carried out the massacre because of his "longstanding hatred of mankind."

In one video shown to jurors, Holmes told a psychiatrist the wounded victims were "collateral damage."

"It sounded like Mr. Brauchler was suggesting that Mr. Holmes might have done this for notoriety," King told jurors.

entry.title: Pictures of movie theatre carnage shown for 1st time at James Holmes shooting trial
entry.summary: Arlene Holmes then left the courtroom with her husband, Bob, and defense attorney Tamara Brady.

entry.title: Colorado movie massacre survivor describes gunman Holmes' actions
Colorado movie massacre survivor describes gunman Holmes' actions
entry.summary:
Prosecutors say Holmes, who was armed with a handgun, shotgun and semiautomatic rifle, carried out the massacre because he had lost his career, girlfriend and purpose in life, and did it "to make himself feel better."

Holmes' public defenders say he was suffering from schizophrenia; that he heard voices in his head telling him to kill; and that he was not in control of his actions "or what he perceived to be reality."

entry.title: Sergeant is 1st witness to identify James Holmes as gunman
entry.summary: Holmes' lawyers did not question Jonsgaard, just as they did not question any of the 10 witnesses who testified Tuesday.

entry.title: Sergeant is 1st witness to identify James Holmes as gunman
entry.summary: Inside, the trial of Aurora movie theater massacre defendant James Holmes continued for its second day.

entry.title: Sergeant is 1st witness to identify James Holmes as gunman
entry.summary: The trial will determine if Holmes, who murdered 12 people during a midnight screening of a Batman movie, will be executed, spend his life in prison or be committed to an institution.

entry.title: Sergeant is 1st witness to identify James Holmes as gunman
entry.summary: Sgt. Gerald Jonsgaard identified James Holmes as that person in court on Wednesday.

entry.title: Sergeant is 1st witness to identify James Holmes as gunman
entry.summary:
The trial will determine if Holmes will be executed, spend his life in prison or be committed to an institution.

Previous witnesses either didn't see Holmes at all or only saw a masked gunman.

entry.title: Sergeant is 1st witness to identify James Holmes as gunman
entry.summary: It was the first time in the trial that a witness described Holmes as the gunman.

The Latest: Courthouse empties after Day 1 of Holmes trial
entry.summary:
Holmes watched the screen with the photographs but showed no visible reaction.

There was a box of tissues at the feet of Holmes' parents but they didn't use them during the opening statements.

entry.title: The Latest: Courthouse empties after Day 1 of Holmes trial
entry.summary: "The 'why' is coming from James Holmes' mind," she said.

entry.title: The Latest: Courthouse empties after Day 1 of Holmes trial
entry.summary:
The trial for James Holmes continues Tuesday morning.

Court has adjourned for the day in the Colorado theater shooting trial after James Holmes' attorneys completed their opening statement.

James Holmes' defense attorney, Daniel King, says his client "now regrets what took place in the theater."

entry.title: The Latest: Courthouse empties after Day 1 of Holmes trial
entry.summary: Holmes' attorneys say he has schizophrenia.

entry.title: James Holmes' Colorado theater shooting jurors weep at photos of victims
entry.summary:
It remains one of America's deadliest shootings, and that Holmes was the lone gunman has never been in doubt.

Based on that, Holmes 'faces some pretty long odds,' he said.

entry.title: The Latest: Defender says Holmes was insane during attack
entry.summary: District Attorney George Brauchler says Holmes felt differently about the people he killed and those he injured in the 2012 shooting in suburban Denver.

entry.title: The Latest: Defender says Holmes was insane during attack
entry.summary:
Brauchler says the gunman, James Holmes, wore headphones and listened to techno music so as not to hear the reaction in the theater.

District Attorney George Brauchler showed jurors photographs of the elaborate booby trap that Colorado theater shooter James Holmes set up in his apartment.

entry.title: The Latest: Defender says Holmes was insane during attack
entry.summary:
As the trial begins, the key won't be whether he caused the carnage, but whether Holmes was sane at the time of the killings.

A public defender says James Holmes was insane when he opened fire in a crowded Colorado movie theater in 2012.

entry.title: The Latest: Courthouse empties after Day 1 of Holmes trial
entry.summary: Colorado theater shooter James Holmes, far left, sits at the defense table at the opening of his trial in Centennial, Colo., Monday, April 27, 2015.

entry.title: The Latest: Holmes called wounded 'collateral damage'
entry.summary:
The prosecutor in the Colorado movie theater shooting trial has played a video recording of one of James Holmes' psychiatric evaluations in which Holmes says he "only counts fatalities" in the attack and those wounded were "collateral damage."

The judge in the Colorado theater shooting trial is explaining to the jury that they must decide whether or not James Holmes was sane at the time of the attack.

The Latest: People at Holmes' hearing disperse during recess
entry.summary: Many of the people who attended a morning hearing in the trial of Colorado theater shooter James Holmes have dispersed while court is in recess, including Holmes' parents.

entry.title: The Latest: People at Holmes' hearing disperse during recess
entry.summary:
James Holmes' parents sat in the second row in the courtroom in the Denver suburb of Centennial.

A steady stream of people walked into the courthouse on a gray and drizzly morning on the opening day of the trial of James Holmes in the 2012 Colorado theater shooting.

Holmes acknowledges killing 12 people and wounding 70 more a packed Aurora theater, but has pleaded not guilty by reason of insanity.

entry.title: The Latest: People at Holmes' hearing disperse during recess
entry.summary: The parents of Colorado theater shooter James Holmes have been seen waiting in line to get into the suburban Denver courthouse where Holmes' long-awaited death penalty trial is getting underway.

entry.title: Long odds for insanity defense in Colorado movie theater massacre trial - VIDEO: Opening arguments to begin in trial - VIDEO: Insanity defense in Holmes trial puts burden to prosecutors
entry.summary:
June 4, 2013: Aurora theater shooting suspect James Holmes is seated in court in Centennial, Colo.

Holmes faces trial starting on April 27, 2015, in the mass shooting in an Aurora, Colo., movie theater that left 12 dead and 70 wounded.

entry.title: Batman Colorado cinema shooting: Watch gunman James Holmes' trial live
entry.summary: Holmes has pleaded not guilty by reason of insanity to opening fire with a handgun, shotgun and semi-automatic rifle inside a crowded midnight screening of the Batman film The Dark Knight Rises.

entry.title: Colo. theater shooting suspect studied brain disorders
entry.summary: Psychosis is something Holmes knew all about.

entry.title: Colo. theater shooter James Holmes? trial to start Monday
entry.summary: When Holmes opened fire inside a packed movie theater in July 2012, killing 12 and injuring 70, it did more than spread fear and heartbreak across the Denver suburbs.

entry.title: James Holmes jury selection completed after months of screening
entry.summary: Holmes is charged with killing 12 people and wounding 70 others in the 20 July 2012 attack at a Denver-area cinema.

entry.title: Jury seated in death penalty trial of Colorado theater shooter James Holmes
entry.summary: Prosecutors insist Holmes was sane and will ask jurors to convict him and sentence him to death.

entry.title: Jury seated in death penalty trial of Colorado theater shooter James Holmes
entry.summary:
If the jury convicts Holmes, the only other option other than a death sentence is life in prison.

Many potential jurors were excused when they said they already had an opinion on Holmes' guilt or were morally opposed to the death penalty.

entry.title: Jury Seated in Death Penalty Trial of Colorado Theater Shooter James Holmes
Fraser-Holmes succumbs to swim pressure
entry.summary:
Gutted former world No.1 Thomas Fraser-Holmes admits he couldn't handle the expectation at the national swimming championships in Sydney after a breakthrough 2014.

Fraser-Holmes has one last chance to impress in the 400m individual medley final on Friday night - the eight day titles' last evening of action.

But alarm bells were ringing when Fraser-Holmes remarkably failed to earn a 200m world titles berth after finishing a distant third in the national final.

All Fraser-Holmes has to show for the titles to date is a 4x200m freestyle relay berth for July's world titles in Kazan, Russia.

entry.title: Fraser-Holmes succumbs to swim pressure
entry.summary: Other winners on the final night were Thomas Fraser-Holmes (men's 400m IM), Keryn McMaster (women's 400m IM), Leiston Pickett (50m breaststroke) and Ben Treffers (50m backstroke).

entry.title: Fraser-Holmes succumbs to swim pressure
entry.summary:
Fraser-Holmes on Friday clocked four minutes, 23.49 seconds to be fifth fastest for the final - well behind top qualifier Travis Mahoney (4:20.76).

Gold Coast's Fraser-Holmes, 23, arrived at the nationals as one of the swimmers to watch.

"Things didn't go how I wanted them on my first day and in swimming it's pretty easy for things to snowball," a shattered Fraser-Holmes said.

Besides the 4x200m relay spot, selectors' discretionary powers may yet grant Fraser-Holmes a nod in the 200m IM and 400m IM events at Kazan.

entry.title: Sport24.co.za | Holmes wins Houston Open in playoff
entry.summary:
From the 18th tee again, Holmes and Wagner both found the fairway.

Holmes' birdie effort trickled right, but his par proved good enough when Wagner's five-foot par putt failed to drop.

entry.title: J.B. Holmes wins in playoff at Houston Open
entry.summary: Wagner and Holmes hit perfect drives on the first playoff hole - both were on No.

entry.title: J.B. Holmes takes Houston Open
J.B. Holmes Takes Houston Open
entry.summary: J.B. Holmes used a strong start Sunday for a Houston Open victory in a three-way playoff against Jordan Spieth and Johnson Wagner.

entry.title: J.B. Holmes wins Houston Open in 3-player playoff
entry.summary: The 32-year-old Holmes birdied the first five holes and nine of the first 12 after starting the day six shots back of Jordan Spieth.

entry.title: Holmes wins in Houston Open playoff
Spieth, Holmes, Wagner in playoff at Houston Open
entry.summary: April 5 (Reuters) - Americans Jordan Spieth, J.B. Holmes and Johnson Wagner are headed to a playoff after finishing in a three-way tie at the Houston Open in Texas.

entry.title: Spieth, Holmes, Wagner in playoff at Houston Open
Spieth, Holmes, Wagner in playoff at Houston Open
entry.summary: Holmes carded a brilliant 64, while Wagner made a rare birdie at the last for a 69.

entry.title: Colorado theater shooter's mom feels guilt over his illness
entry.summary:
The mother of Colorado theater shooter James Holmes feels guilty for not knowing her son was mentally ill and needed treatment, she wrote in a book of prayers and reflections compiled since the 2012 attack.

Arlene Holmes said her son's defense team had no knowledge of the book.

entry.title: Katie Holmes smoulders at film premiere
entry.summary: In a cut-out dress that hugged in all the right places, Katie Holmes has stunned onlookers at the New York City premiere of her new film "Woman in Gold".
